newsitem.title: ITALY: FORECAST-Italy mkt expectation of rate fall grows.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Italy mkt expectation of rate fall grows.

text.p: Italy's money market has higher expectations of a fall in interest rates in the coming month, a Bocconi University study based on implicit forward rates showed.

Many in the market had expected the Bank of Italy to ease the official 6.75 percent discount rate this week after preliminary May inflation data showed price growth slowing to 1.5/1.6 percent year on year from April's 1.7 percent.
The central bank has so far left official rates untouched.

But the Bocconi study sees the implicit overnight rate at 6.78 percent in a month's time against 6.95 percent forecast a week ago and an official market close of 6.92 percent on Thursday, the day on which the study was based. One week ago the official overnight rate stood at 7.07 percent.
On a three month horizon, the market sees the implicit overnight rate falling to 6.57 percent, compared with 6.75 percent forecast a week ago and 6.79 percent one month ago.
On a one year horizon the implicit overnight rate is seen falling to 6.35 percent from 6.40 percent forecast last week and 6.67 percent seen one month ago.
But over a two year period, the rate is seen rising to 6.80 percent from 6.65 percent expected a week ago.

The spread between the implicit overnight rate in Italy and that in Germany, considered a good indicator of market confidence of Italy's entry into Europe's Economic and Monetary Union, this week fell to 203 basis points from 212 a week ago and 245 one month ago.
